channel.title: Development Watch - June
channel.description: This thread will be used to share and discuss any potential candidate(s) for the "Notable Developments" section in the Mopar Monthly issue that will be published at the end of June. Notable points will be placed into the OP.

item.title: Development Watch - June
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Absolutely. I do have faith in the project because I know that Int Bauk knows what he’s doing to an extent, which is why I’m still willing to watch over the development. As you might know by now though, the ‘Notable Developments’ category is reserved for steady, strong developments, yet this development is lacking in both at the moment.

Read full topic

item.title: Development Watch - June
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Flame_:

The development is quite gradual, but if there is some sort of programming burst within that development in the next week or so I’d consider it. The problem being as I said, the development is very slow and there is only an update once every week or so, correct me if I’m wrong.

Yeah, the development has been quite slow but I think we should keep an eye on it incase it picks up. Even so, it’s an interesting development, just lacking in the speed department

Read full topic

item.title: Development Watch - June
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

The development is quite gradual, but if there is some sort of programming burst within that development in the next week or so I’d consider it. The problem being as I said, the development is very slow and there is only an update once every week or so, correct me if I’m wrong.

item.title: Development Watch - June
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Have you taken a look at Int Bauk’s development “Neitiznot”? It looks as though he’s put some decent effort into it so far. Might be another one for the watchlist.

Read full topic

item.title: Development Watch - June
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:3, topic:521000”]I’m all for the RuneZ development watch, as it is an interesting development and the community seems to be taking a liking to it.
As for enzo’s development, I’d like to keep a closer watch on it and leave it as ‘considered’ for the time being. Seeing as he is rewriting most content rather than creating his own, I haven’t seen anything that has too much oomph to it. If his development goes on and I see substantial progress, then we will mention him.[/quote]
I definitely preferred RuneZ over enzo’s development, it’s just a lot more unique and new, taking both creativity and skill to pull of. But I do believe that we should keep watch on enzo’s development incase he pulls something out of the bag unexpectedly.

[quote=“Flame_, post:3, topic:521000”]My own nomination:
Narusimu by the user MistaBigBoss. The overall concept is something that many people are scared to approach development-wise, and there is definitely a portion of the community interested with how this goes. He apparently started the project back in late 2012, and the previews of the game look pretty cool.[/quote]
Wow. Definitely. I hadn’t read that thread before because I thought it was a game rather than a development by a member from our community and Naruto isn’t among my interests. But wow, that really is fantastic. Absolutely has my vote for this month.

Read full topic

item.title: Development Watch - June
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

I’m all for the RuneZ development watch, as it is an interesting development and the community seems to be taking a liking to it.
As for enzo’s development, I’d like to keep a closer watch on it and leave it as ‘considered’ for the time being. Seeing as he is rewriting most content rather than creating his own, I haven’t seen anything that has too much oomph to it. If his development goes on and I see substantial progress, then we will mention him.

My own nomination:
Narusimu by the user MistaBigBoss. The overall concept is something that many people are scared to approach development-wise, and there is definitely a portion of the community interested with how this goes. He apparently started the project back in late 2012, and the previews of the game look pretty cool.

Read full topic

item.title: Development Watch - June
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

I’m going to make two nominations for this award.
Firstly, I’d like to nominate the RuneZ development by 12igon8. It’s a very unique project and he appears to be taking it seriously and putting a good amount of effort into it so I think this is a good candidate for the award.
The second nomination is “a better/more up-to-date Delta” by enzo42. He is making good progress on this and I think it will be good to have a more up-to-date version of DeltaScape, especially if he is going to improve it in the way he says that he is (and he is already showing good improvements upon it).

Read full topic
